intro: Rogiera nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan rogeria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
